metadata.title: CVE-2012-6702 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Expat, when used in a parser that has not called XML_SetHashSalt or passedit a seed of 0, makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to defeatcryptographic protection mechanisms via vectors involving use of the srandfunction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
